children: Hemorrhoids are vascular cushions that support the muscles of the anal sphincter by swelling up as needed to maintain stool continence. Prolapsed hemorrhoids (
) are internal hemorrhoids that protrude out of the rectum. The hallmark of rectal prolapse (
) is the identification of concentric rings of the rectum protruding through the anus. Prolapsed polyps (
) present as mucosa-covered globular masses protruding from the anus.
